KnowledgeBase.Title: isBound
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes: Structure Integer Boolean Dictionary Integer Boolean Directory Integer Boolean

Function.Description: The isBound function returns the index, of the specified symbol if found within the Structure, Dictionary or Directory. If not found, the Boolean value false is returned.

Brief.Overview: The isBound function returns the index, of the specified symbol {name}, within the Structure {struct}, Dictionary {dict} or Directory{dir}. If the symbol is not bound within the Structure, the Boolean value, false is returned.
Brief.Usage: Use the isBound function to determine if a symbol is in a Structure, Dictionary or a Directory. It is similar to the member function.

Syntax-Structure.Return: Returns the index where the name was found. If not found false is returned

Syntax-Dictionary.Return: Returns the index where the name was found. If not found false is returned

Syntax-Directory.Return: Returns the index where the name was found. If not found false is returned
